summary: Interactive romantic-themed Valentine web page (HTML/CSS/JS) with Yes/No choice where No evades hover, and Yes reveals a meme image/message; designed to run in Chrome on iPad.
architectural_notes: Single-page static site (HTML/CSS/JS) intended to run locally in Chrome on iPad
imageRequirements:
## Required Images
- Meme-style romantic graphic with bold top/bottom caption reading “I KNEW YOU WOULD SAY YES AND CHOOSE ME ANYDAY OVER ANYONE” in high-contrast lettering on a pink/white themed background (valentine-meme.dim_1200x800.png)

existing_features.title: Create a single-page romantic Valentine web experience that asks: “Will you be my Valentine?” with two prominent options: “Yes” and “No”, using a pink-and-white romantic theme and responsive layout suitable for iPad Chrome.

Implement an interaction where the “No” button evades the user so it cannot be clicked: when the pointer hovers over or approaches the “No” button (pointerenter/mouseover), it moves to a new position on the screen within the visible container; also handle touch interactions on iPad (pointerdown/touchstart) by moving the button before it can be tapped.
When the user clicks “Yes”, replace the choice UI with a celebratory reveal that displays a meme image and the exact message: “I KNEW YOU WOULD SAY YES AND CHOOSE ME ANYDAY OVER ANYONE”.
Add the required generated meme image to the frontend as a static asset under frontend/public/assets/generated and render it directly from the frontend (no backend image routing).
